doc.after: PTFE has the lowest coefficient of friction of any known solid material. It is used as a non-stick coating for pans and other cookware. PTFE is very non-reactive and is often used in containers and pipework for reactive chemicals. Its melting point is 327Â°C, but its properties degrade above 260Â°C. At this point gaseous fluorine compounds are released that are dangerous to humans.
